result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew S. Poyner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Credit for 1 day served if revoked.

miscConds.notes: Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
*  Pay supervision fees.
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
DOC shall promptly notify the Court of any new arrest or criminal charge made against the Deft.

records.addlTxt: Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge  kmk

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Kraus appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Rocco DeFilippis.  Warrant is vacated; bond reinstated.  Case is resolved.  Deft pleads guilty; found guilty by the Court.  Sentencing arguments made.  Sentence w/held; placed on probation for one year.  See conditions.  Appeal rights.  If revoked, credit for 1 day.
Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Kraus appeared for the State.  Atty DeFilippis appeared on behalf of deft.  No appearance by deft.  Warrant authorized; $500 cash bond.  Prior bond forfeited.

Minutes:  NO RECORD TAKEN due to ongoing jury trial.  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Rocco DeFilippis.  Defense counsel moves for a short adjournment; letter has been written to Judge Torhorst requesting an expunction on a Racine case.  JS to be left on for 6/22/15 @ 9am.  Atty DeFilippis reports the case will most likely settle.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.  kmk
